Package net.varkhan.base.containers

Enhanced Java data containers.

This package defines several abstract containers for Java data types, similar in purpose to the Java Collections framework, but with richer semantics.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Collection<Type> A modifiable object container.

This container stores objects, that can be retrieved through an Iterator giving access to all the elements of the container.
Container<Type> An object container.

This container stores objects, that can be retrieved through an Iterator giving access to all the elements of the container.
HashingStrategy<Type> A coordinated pair of hash-code and equality computing algorithms.

Implementations of this interface provide a method testing for equality of two objects of a given type, and a method to compute hash-codes for this type of object, that returns a unique value for all objects that test equal.
Index A bidirectional iterator over an Indexed content container.

IndexIterators enumerate valid long indexes for the contents of an Indexed container, allowing both forward and backward traversal.
Indexable A view of the indexes in an Indexed content container.

Convenience object to access an Index over some subset of indexes from an Indexed container.
Indexed<Type> A container whose elements can be retrieved through a long index.

This container stores objects, that are associated to a unique index through which they can be retrieved.
IndexedCollection<Type> A modifiable container that associates a long index to each element.

This container stores objects, that are mapped to a unique index through which they can be retrieved.
IndexedContainer<Type> A container that associates a long index to each element.

This container stores objects, that are mapped to a unique index through which they can be retrieved.
IndexedOperable<Type> Applies an operator to a subset of the objects in an indexed container.

Convenience object to allow applying an IndexedOperable.IndexedOperator callback over some subset of the elements of a container.
IndexedOperable.IndexedOperator<Type,Par> A callback, or procedure, used by the IndexedOperable.operate(net.varkhan.base.containers.IndexedOperable.IndexedOperator).

A Visitor callback takes a single object of the type supported by the container, processes that element, and returns a new element value that replaces the original argument.
IndexedSearchable<Key,Value> A searchable indexed container.

This container stores objects, that are mapped to a unique index through which they can be retrieved.
IndexedVisitable<Type> Applies a visitor to a subset of the objects in an indexed container.

Convenience object to allow applying an IndexedVisitable.IndexedVisitor callback over some subset of the elements of a container.
IndexedVisitable.IndexedVisitor<Type,Par> A callback, or procedure, used by the IndexedVisitable.visit(net.varkhan.base.containers.IndexedVisitable.IndexedVisitor, Par).

An IndexedVisitor callback takes an index and single object of the type supported by the container, processes that element, and returns a long value that signifies the end of the iteration if negative, and is added to the total visiting count otherwise.
Iterable<Type> A view of the objects in a content container.

Convenience object to access an Iterator over some subset of indexes from a container, allowing overriding classes to return more specific element types.
Iterator<Type> An iterator over the objects in a content container.

This interface has been copied from Iterator (which it extends), for convenience in proximity of Iterable.
Operable<Type> Applies an operator to a subset of the objects in a container.

Convenience object to allow applying an Operable.Operator callback over some subset of the elements of a container.
Operable.Operator<Type,Par> A callback, or procedure, used by the Operable.operate(net.varkhan.base.containers.Operable.Operator).

A Visitor callback takes a single object of the type supported by the container, processes that element, and returns a new element value that replaces the original argument.
Searchable<Key> A searchable container.

This container allows to test for the presence or absence of a given object.
Visitable<Type> Applies a visitor to a subset of the objects in a container.

Convenience object to allow applying a Visitable.Visitor callback over some subset of the elements of a container.
Visitable.Visitor<Type,Par> A callback, or procedure, used by the Visitable.visit(net.varkhan.base.containers.Visitable.Visitor, Par).

A Visitor callback takes a single object of the type supported by the container, processes that element, and returns a long value that signifies the end of the iteration if negative, and is added to the total visiting count otherwise.
 

Class Summary
Containers Static Container manipulation utilities..
Hashes .
Index.Empty An empty index iterator (whose hasNext() and hasPrevious() methods always return false, and current(), next() and previous() methods throw an Index.InvalidIndexException).
Index.Enumerate An enumeration iterator, that returns all indexes in an array, in order.
Index.Range A range iterator, that returns all indexes in a range.
Index.Sequence A sequence iterator, that returns all the indexes of a series of Indexes, in order.
Index.Singleton A singleton iterator, that returns a single element.
Indexable.Empty An empty Indexable, that always yield an empty iterator.
Indexable.Enumerate An enumeration iterable, that returns an Enumeration iterator, iterating on the indexes in an array.
Indexable.Range A range iterable, that returns a Range iterator, iterating on a range of index.
Indexable.Sequence A sequence iterable, that returns a Sequence iterator, iterating on the indexes in an array.
Indexable.Singleton A singleton iterable, that returns a Singleton iterator, iterating on a single index.
Iterator.Empty<Type> An empty index iterator (whose hasNext() and hasPrevious() methods always return false, and next() returns null.
Iterator.Enumerate<Type> An enumeration iterator, that returns all elements in an array, in order.
Iterator.Sequence<Type> A sequence iterator, that returns all the elements of a series of iterators, in order.
Iterator.Singleton<Type> A singleton iterator, that returns a single element.
Reflect Reflection tools.

Reflexive object structure examination, and heap monitoring tools.
Reflect.Fld<Type> An object's field specifications.
Reflect.Ref<Type> A reference to an object.
SyncContainer<Type> Provide multithread safety over an unsynchronized ontainer implementation

This class wraps an unsynchronized Container implementation in a read/write synchronized layer, provided all read operations on the underlying container are state-less (i.e.
SyncIndexedContainer<Type> Provide multithread safety over an unsynchronized IndexedContainer implementation

This class wraps an unsynchronized IndexedContainer implementation in a read/write synchronized layer, provided all read operations on the underlying container are state-less (i.e.
 

Exception Summary
Index.InvalidIndexException An exception thrown upon lookup of a non-existing index.

An Index or an Indexed content container may throw this exception when asked to retrieve an object at an invalid index, or an index that does not have associated content.
 

Package net.varkhan.base.containers Description

Enhanced Java data containers.

This package defines several abstract containers for Java data types, similar in purpose to the Java Collections framework, but with richer semantics.
